III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Communication.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4124
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a written policy regarding
Description communication that ensures that a child is able to communicate
with family and friends in a manner appropriate to the child's
functioning and consistent with the child's treatment plan and
security level.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth is not receiving books and mail sent to the facility from
family.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 11/19/2024. Complainant did
not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 11/20/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth A stated she is on Unit 2A and did not
have concerns. Youth A was asked if she had concerns with
receiving mail. Youth A stated she has not received mail.
Attempted to reinterview Youth A on 12/19/2024 about her mail,
but she was discharged home to her mother on 12/06/2024.
Youth B was interviewed on 12/26/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth B stated youths receive mail without
issue on Unit 2B.
Youth C was interviewed on 12/26/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth C stated she was on Unit 2A until it
recently merged with Unit 2B. Youth C stated youths received mail
without issue on Unit 2A and receive mail without issue Unit 2B.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 12/26/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 1 stated she is assigned to work Unit 2B. Staff 1
stated youths receive mail once it is delivered to the unit.
Youth A’s mother was interviewed on 11/19/2024 by phone.
Youth A’s mother stated Youth A has not received the paper mail
and books she sent. Youth A’s mother provided the address to
where she sent the items and the address is correct. Youth A’s
mother stated she addressed the mail with her daughter’s name
2

followed by the word “Inmate”. Youth A’s mother left a message
on 12/05/2024 stating Youth A received her paper mail on
12/03/2024. Youth A’s mother also stated Wayne County Juvenile
Detention requested her to pick up Youth A’s books from the
agency. Youth A’s mother has not returned calls placed on
12/12/2024 and 12/18/2024 to confirm the return and pick up of
Youth A’s books.
Manager was interviewed on 11/20/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Manager stated Wayne County Juvenile
Detention’s mail and packages go to Freeman Company for
processing before it is delivered to the youths. Manager stated a
letter was mailed out to parents stating youths may not receive
books from visitors or books mailed to them. Manager stated the
agency provides book of various genres for the youths. Manager
stated a case manager will contact Youth A’s mother to pick up
the books she sent once they are located.
Documentation
Visitors were notified verbally during visitation and a letter
prohibiting books brought in or mailed to youths was sent to youth
families on 11/25/2024 per Deputy Director’s 11/26/2024 email.
Letter dated 11/25/2024 sent to youth families states books may
not be brought in by visitors or mailed to youths. It states Wayne
County Juvenile Detention will provide books to ensure
appropriate content and for safety measures.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance in giving youth their mail.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
3
